MDMA Dosage

by Erowid


                    Context: 
                    This fragment provides detailed information on MDMA dosage, including typical tablet content, recreational and therapeutic dose ranges, onset and duration, overdose effects, and references. It is part of Erowid’s comprehensive resources on psychoactive substances, specifically focusing on MDMA, to aid user understanding of safe use and effects within the broader context of chemical and drug information.

Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on MDMA dosage.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    MDMA generally comes in the form of small tablets, capsules, or white powder. When found in tablet form (often referred to as "ecstasy"), it is common for MDMA to be combined with any of the following substances : MDMA, Caffeine, MDA, Methamphetamine, DXM, MDE, Pseudo/Ephedrine, Ketamine, BZP, and TFMPP. Chemical analysis of ecstasy tablets has found from 0 - 120 mg of MDMA as well as a variety of the above substances. Trying to calculate dosages from tablets containing unknown quantities of MDMA can be difficult, but a high quality tablet of street ecstasy (those containing MDMA alone) generally contains between 80 and 120 mg of MDMA. Some unusual tablets (especially in Europe) contain 150mg or more. The chart below shows what are considered recreational/therapeutic dosages for pure MDMA HCl (the most common crystalline form), measured in milligrams. Note that most Ecstasy and even crystalline MDMA is not 100% pure and may contain fillers or other drugs. See DrugsData.org (formerly


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed information on MDMA dosage forms, including common tablet compositions, typical purity levels, and recreational dose ranges in milligrams. It is relevant within the broader webpage, which covers various drugs and chemicals, by offering specific guidance on MDMA usage, potency, and considerations for safety. This section aids users in understanding dosage variability and purity concerns for MDMA.

Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on MDMA dosage.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    HCl (the most common crystalline form), measured in milligrams. Note that most Ecstasy and even crystalline MDMA is not 100% pure and may contain fillers or other drugs. See DrugsData.org (formerly EcstasyData).


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt discusses the typical purity and composition of crystalline MDMA, especially in tablet form, highlighting that it is often not 100% pure and may contain fillers or other substances. It emphasizes the importance of understanding dosage and purity, referencing sources like DrugsData.org for more detailed analysis, making it relevant for accurate harm reduction and drug information within the MDMA dosage section.

Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on MDMA dosage.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Oral MDMA Dosages Threshold 30 mg Light 40 - 75 mg Common (small or sensitive people) 60 - 90 mg Common (most people) 75 - 125 mg Common (large or less sensitive people) 110 - 150 mg Strong 150 - 200  mg Heavy 200 +  mg Onset : 20 - 70 minutes (depending on form and stomach contents) Duration : 3 - 5 hours Normal After Effects : up to 24 hours

Overdose Effects: Vomiting, headaches and dizziness may result from too high a dose of MDMA. Some people are considerably more sensitive to MDMA than others. Be careful if you are using MDMA for the first time or using material of an unknown purity and strength. Always start low.


                    Context: 
                    This section provides dosage guidelines and safety notes for MDMA, detailing typical recreational and therapeutic dose ranges, onset and duration times, and overdose effects. It is part of the detailed chemical information on MDMA within the broader Erowid drug information resource, supporting harm reduction and informed use.

Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on MDMA dosage.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Every individual reacts differently to every chemical. Know your Body - Know your Mind - Know your Substance - Know your Source. Erowid's dosage information is a summary of data gathered from users, research, and other resources and should not be construed as recommendations.  Individuals can respond differently to the same dosage.  What is safe for one can be deadly for another. Start low with new substances. Have trusted companion/guide/sitter/friend present and/or available.

REFERENCES #

Harris DS, Baggott M, Mendelson J, Mendelson JE, Jones RT. "Subjective and hormonal effects of 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine (MDMA) in humans" Psychopharmacology (Berl). 2002;162:396-405.

Vollenweider FX, Gamma A, Liechti M, Huber T. "Psychological and cardiovascular effects and short-term sequelae of MDMA ('ecstasy') in MDMA-naive healthy volunteers" Neuropsychopharmacology. 1998 Oct;19(4):241-51.


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt emphasizes individual variability in reactions to chemicals like MDMA and highlights the importance of personalized dosage awareness. It includes a safety disclaimer, advice to start with low doses, and references to scientific studies, serving as a critical safety and research summary within the MDMA dosage section of the webpage.

Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on MDMA dosage.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Baggott MJ, Coyle JR, Siegrist JD, Garrison KJ, Galloway GP, Mendelson JE. "Effects of 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine on socioemotional feelings, authenticity, and autobiographical disclosure in healthy volunteers in a controlled setting" J Psychopharmacol. 2016 Feb 19;.
